comments.body: 2.3 is released so you can do this TODO.
Might be nice to do it for `@storybook/react` too
@sandersn Is there an example of a scoped package that has done this already? Do you think we can do it as a follow-up and do both packages at once?

I just tried removing the wrappers, but now get:
```
/Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped/types/storybook__addon-knobs/index.d.ts
ERROR: 10:32  expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/react'.

/Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped/types/storybook__addon-knobs/storybook__addon-knobs-tests.tsx
ERROR: 2:27   expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/react'.
ERROR: 14:8   expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/addon-knobs'.
```

I have used `/// <reference types="storybook__react" />` at the top of the file, but for some reason it still is not picked up correctly. Any idea what I might be doing wrong?

Tried a `rm -rf node_modules` and clean install to make sure its not an outdated `dtslint` version.

Full command:

```
$ npm run lint storybook__addon-knobs

> definitely-typed@0.0.1 lint /Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped
> dtslint types "storybook__addon-knobs"

Installing to /Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped/node_modules/dtslint/typescript-installs/2.3...
npm notice created a lockfile as package-lock.json. You should commit this file.

Installed!
/Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped/types/storybook__addon-knobs/index.d.ts
ERROR: 8:32  expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/react'.

/Users/joscha/Development/DefinitelyTyped/types/storybook__addon-knobs/storybook__addon-knobs-tests.tsx
ERROR: 4:27  expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/react'.
ERROR: 16:8  expect  TypeScript compile error: Cannot find module '@storybook/addon-knobs'.

npm ERR! code ELIFECYCLE
npm ERR! errno 1

npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR!
npm ERR! Failed at the definitely-typed@0.0.1 lint script.
npm ERR! This is probably not a problem with npm. There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! A complete log of this run can be found in:
npm ERR!     /Users/joscha/.npm/_logs/2017-06-22T21_00_18_487Z-debug.log
```

The branch with the `declare` removals diffs as following to this one here: https://github.com/joscha/DefinitelyTyped/compare/joscha/add-@storybook/addon-knobs...joscha:joscha/add-@storybook/addon-knobs-remove-declare?expand=1
I think @andy-ms is the better one to ask since I think he made the name-mangling-lookup change.
There should be one more argument "groupName"

You missed this case:

```
export function select<T>(name: string, options: ReadonlyArray<T> }, value: T, groupId?: string): T;
```

@alanhchoi 

The following cases should be acceptable.

```
select('padding', [4, 8, 16], 4)
```

`T` must extends string or number.

@akameco Hi! That's my bad. Thank you for pointing it out and I created a new pull request https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/33796. Please check the test file in the PR and see if it matches with your case.
@alanhchoi Thank you for the quick fix! LGTM 👍
